segments.text: I find myself growing quite irritated by this entire situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can that woman be so utterly blind to the overflowing sink?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's not just a small drip; it's a constant stream, creating a huge puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is literally in the water, and she just keeps polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a colossal waste of water, for one thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the potential damage to the floor and cabinets is infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then there are the children, putting themselves in harm's way on that ridiculous stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why is no one preventing this mess, this disaster?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's just utterly irresponsible on so many levels.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kind of negligence really gets under my skin.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could shout at them to wake up and pay attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast with the calm outside only makes the inside seem more maddening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What a truly frustrating scene to witness.
segments.speaker: PAR
